## Advanced card features

### Navset cards

Navset cards are similar to `page_navbar()` or the `navset_*()` function variants.
They all follow the same pattern of `navset_card_{type}`:

::: {.column-screen-inset-right}
```{shinylive-r}
#| standalone: true
#| components: [editor, viewer]
library(shiny)
library(bslib)

ui <- page_fillable(
  navset_card_tab(
    nav_panel(
        "First tab name",
        "... first tab content"
    ),
    nav_panel(
        "Second tab name",
        "... second tab content"
    )
  )
)

shinyApp(ui, \(...) { })
```
:::

### Navset cards with sidebars

With navset cards, you have two sidebar choices:

* For local sidebars in one of the nav panels, nest `layout_sidebar()` inside the `nav_panel()`.
* For global sidebars, use the `sidebar` argument.

::: {.column-screen-inset-right}
```{shinylive-r}
#| standalone: true
#| components: [editor, viewer]
library(shiny)
library(bslib)

ui <- page_fillable(
  navset_card_tab(
    nav_panel(
        "First tab name",
        "... first tab content"
    ),
    nav_panel(
        "Second tab name",
        "... second tab content"
    )
  )
)

shinyApp(ui, \(...) { })
```
:::
